Last night, a massive Russian Geran-2 drone attack was carried out on Donetsk Oblast.
At least 35 drones attacked various targets in the region, including in Dobropillya, Sviatohorivka, Myrove, Novovodyane and Kramatorsk.

Last night, a massive Russian Geran-2 drone attack was carried out on Donetsk Oblast.
At least 35 drones attacked various targets in the region, including in Dobropillya, Sviatohorivka, Myrove, Novovodyane and Kramatorsk.

As a result of new Russian advances in the Siversk, Lyman, Dobropillya, and Bilozerske directions, the Donetsk OVA has announced mandatory evacuation orders for families with children in 38 different settlements in Donetsk Oblast since August 8. 
Among these settlements are the cities of Druzhkivka and Bilozerske. Additionally, 3 villages not in their announced list are being evacuated, and the city of Lyman is now under an evacuation order for all civilians. 
The purple line on the map represents the current evacuation zones, and the yellow markers represent the settlements added to the evacuation zone since August 8.
There is some truth to the Deepstate and Azov claims it seems
KAB glide-bomb over northern Kharkiv
KAB glide-bomb over northern Kharkiv
Explosion in Kharkiv City

Ukrainian forces have recaptured the village of Vesele, Bilozerske direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~227.
Total land area: ~0.91km¬≤.

Ukrainian forces have recaptured the village of Zolotyi Kolodyaz, Bilozerske direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~910.
Total land area: ~2.47 km¬≤.

Ukrainian forces have re-established control over the village of Rubizhne, Bilozerske direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~105.
Total land area: ~0.47km¬≤.

Ukrainian forces have recaptured the village of Vilne, Dobropillya direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~71.
Total land area: ~0.30km¬≤.

Ukrainian forces have recaptured the village of Ivanivka, Dobropillya direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~54.
Total land area: ~0.27km¬≤.

Ukrainian forces have recaptured the village of Dorozhnje, Dobropillya direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~96.
Total land area: ~0.58km¬≤.

In the Dobropillya-Bilozerske direction, both Russian and Ukrainian forces have been advancing, with Ukrainian forces making significant progress towards eliminating the Russian wedge to Zolotyi Kolodyaz.
Ukrainian forces re-established control over the village of Hruzke and the gulley running southwards, before pushing into Vesele from multiple directions, where they recaptured it and the surrounding areas.
To the west, after a failed attempt at entering it, the Ukrainians attacked Zolotyi Kolodyaz from the forests to the west again and broke through to the centre of the village. Fierce fighting ensued for around 24 hours, with the Russians being forced to retreat south due to the loss of Vesele and Hruzke, as well as because of Ukraine's numerical superiority here. Those same forces then pushed south and have reached the northern outskirts of Kucheriv Yar. 
Additionally, after days of positional battles, Ukrainian forces pushed east from their positions in Rubizhne, and recaptured the rest of the village, which Russia had to withdraw from due to the loss of Zolotyi Kolodyaz. From there, Ukrainian forces pushed further and captured treeline positions on the nearby tactical heights, and in the gulley leading south from Zolotyi Kolodyaz.
To the south, the Ukrainians pushed outwards from Stepy, establishing a buffer zone in the treelines on the tactical heights there, while other forces moved along the heights to Vilne, which also came under their control.
Furthermore, Ukrainian forces advanced east from Novyi Donbas, and entered the village of Nove Shakhove, capturing the western houses. They were also able to recapture the village of Ivanivka, as well as  Dorozhnje, which allowed for them to re-enter Nykanorivka which is now partially in the grey zone. 
Russian forces on the other hand, were able to improve their positions west of Shakhove around a week ago, advancing downhill through two parallel gulleys, capturing positions in the forest plantations there. 
+ ~60.60km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.
+ ~6.78km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Dobropillya-Bilozerske direction, both Russian and Ukrainian forces have been advancing, with Ukrainian forces making significant progress towards eliminating the Russian wedge to Zolotyi Kolodyaz.  Ukrainian forces re-established control over the village‚Ä¶

Now that Ukraine has achieved significant success in their counterattacks in the Bilozerske-Dobropillya direction, watch out for Pro-Russians suddenly switching up their opinions on this initial Russian breakthrough by claiming that "oh actually, it was just a few DRGs all along!!!" Those will be the same people declaring that this was a collapse (which it initially was). 
No. Russia achieved a breakthrough, Ukraine moved in a lot of reinforcements from other areas of the front, counterattacked, and made large gains. While the claims of large groups of Russians being encircled are likely false, Deepstate and Azov were correct in saying that Ukraine was able to significantly advance. I doubted them, and I was wrong. 
Now let's see what happens in these areas where Ukrainian reinforcements were pulled from, namely the Kostyantynivka direction. It will be a good case study, as we haven't seen large scale movements from one direction to another since around a year ago in Kursk.

In the Dobropillya-Bilozerske direction, both Russian and Ukrainian forces have been advancing, with Ukrainian forces making significant progress towards eliminating the Russian wedge to Zolotyi Kolodyaz.  Ukrainian forces re-established control over the village‚Ä¶

Israel Bolster Air Defenses In Preparations Of Second War With Iran 
The Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) is accelerating plans to strengthen its multi-layered defense capabilities in anticipation of a new war with Iran or more missile attacks by the Houthis in Yemen, Walla News reported on August 15.
According to the Hebrew news site, Director General of the Defense Ministry, Maj. Gen. Amir Baram, has ordered the expedited development and production of air defense systems, including the Arrow 3, Arrow 4, Iron Dome, David‚Äôs Sling, and a ground-based laser system.
Read more: 
HERE

U.S. Deploys 4,000 Troops, Carrier, Submarine And More On Counter-Cartel Mission 
CNN on August 15 provided more details about the United States‚Äô recent decision to deploy air and naval forces to Latin America and the Caribbean to address the threat posed by drug cartels.
The deployment was first reported by Reuters a day earlier. It came in as a part of the efforts the administration of President Donald Trump is making to counter drug trafficking into the U.S.
In a first step, the U.S. designated last February Mexico‚Äôs Sinaloa Cartel and other drug gangs as well as Venezuelan criminal group Tren de Aragua as global terrorist organizations. A report from The New York Times released earlier this month alleged that Trump had secretly signed a directive to begin using military force against the groups.
Read more: 
HERE

Israeli Navy Attacks Power Plant Near Yemen‚Äôs Sanaa 
The Israeli Navy early on August 17 launched strikes against a power plant located south of the Yemeni capital, Sanaa, which is held by the Houthis (Ansar Allah).
In a statement, the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) said that the strikes hit ‚Äúenergy infrastructure used by the Houthi terror regime,‚Äù near Sanaa, in response to ‚Äúrepeated attacks by the Houthi terror regime against the State of Israel and its citizens, including the launching of surface-to-surface missiles and UAVs toward Israeli territory.‚Äù
The Al-Masirah TV, which is run by the Houthis, said that the Hezyaz power plant was subjected to ‚Äúan American-Israeli aggression.‚Äù
The channel later reported that workers and firefighters had put out a fire caused by the attack, and that work to repair the damage was underway.
Read more 
HERE

Lebanese Warplane Conducted Patrol Over Syria Following Threats
For the first time ever, a warplane of the Lebanese Air Force (LAF) conducted on August 17 a patrol over Syria, specifically over the southern countryside of Homs in the center of the country. The unprecedented move came following threats to Beirut from Bedouin tribes loyal to the Islamist-led interim government in Damascus.
Data from the Flightradar24, which the patrol was spotted on, identified the warplane as an American-made A-29 Super Tucano turboprop light attack and counter-insurgency aircraft.
The patrol came exactly two days after some Bedouin tribes allied to the Syrian government gave Lebanon a ‚Äú48 ultimatum‚Äù to release some 2,000 Syrian prisoners, including many Islamists who were convicted of terrorism.
Read more 
HERE

Russia Tests New Drone-Ready Engineering Charge 
Russia‚Äôs Bars-Sarmat Center for Special-purpose Unmanned Systems has tested a new engineering charge, dubbed KZ-7, designed to be used as a warhead for suicide drones.
Video footage showing a live test of the KZ-7 was released on August 17. During the test, the charge, which weights 6,5 kg, was installed in a horizontal position 12 meters away from the targets. It was able to penetrate 700 mm of reinforced concrete, and 400 mm of rolled homogeneous armor.
Read more 
HERE

NATO‚Äôs New Ally? Argentina And UK Secret Military Ties To Counter China In The South Atlantic
The South Atlantic, a region often overlooked in global geopolitics, is quietly becoming a theater of strategic maneuvering, with Britain and Argentina engaging in underreported military dialogue to counter Chinese influence. This development, driven by Argentine President Javier Milei‚Äôs pro-Western pivot, could reshape Latin America‚Äôs geopolitical landscape, bolster the US-led West‚Äôs position in the Southern Cone, and even ripple into the BRICS alliance.
According to an Economist¬†piece, Britain and Argentina have resumed defense talks after years of estrangement, spurred by Milei‚Äôs unorthodox stance on the Falklands and concerns about China‚Äôs growing footprint in the South Atlantic.
Argentina currently seeks to modernize its dilapidated armed forces with NATO-compatible equipment, while Britain is considering loosening its stringent arms export restrictions.
Read more 
HERE

Hamas, Islamic Jihad Are Still Resisting In Gaza 
The Hamas Movement and the Palestinian Islamic Jihad continue to put on serious resistance in the Gaza Strip as the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) prepares to mount an unprecedented offensive on the heart of the enclave.
The two factions shared between August 14 and 17 several videos documenting some of their recent operations against the IDF.
The first video shared by Hamas‚Äô military wing, the al-Qassam Brigades, shows the group‚Äôs fighters clashing with Israeli troops from close range in the outskirts of Gaza City in the northern part of the Strip. The second video shows similar clashes from the city of Khan Younis in southern Gaza.
In both videos, Hamas fighters target Israeli troops with sniper rifles, blow up main battle tanks, armored personnel vehicles and armored bulldozers with rocket propelled grenades and shelling gatherings of the IDF with mortars.
Read more 
HERE

Druze In Syria Demand Right Of Self Determination 
Hundreds of Druze demonstrated in the city of al-Suwayda and other parts of the southern Syrian governorate on August 16 to demand the right to self determination.
Some of the protesters waved Israeli flags to thank Israel for intervening on their side during the battle with the forces of Syria‚Äôs Islamist-led interim government and affiliated Bedouin tribes last month.
The protesters in al-Suwayda expressed their rejection of the interim government and demanded that those responsible for atrocities against Druze be brought to justice. Some of the protesters called on Israel to intervene to support their demand of self determination.
Read more 
HERE
